data.name: [BF] Memory Limited Logical Edition: The full package (Using only 2 cells)
data.description:
Before attempting this kata, it is advised to complete the BF Logic series below first:
* [Logic series #1: OR](https://www.codewars.com/kata/644a02f26ed5524894057949)
* [Logic series #2: AND](https://www.codewars.com/kata/644b53235017ed6e80cf6f63)
* [Logical series #3: XOR](https://www.codewars.com/kata/644b5e3d6ed55235e90599e8)
* [Logical series #4: EQUAL](https://www.codewars.com/kata/644bba9faf91ec0059b8f3f4)

----

## Task Description

Given two input characters (ranging from `0` - `255` inclusive), what is the least amount of Brain<sup>TM</sup> cells you need to compute and return their boolean OR operation result... 2 cells? Then how about AND? XOR? Checking for equality? Still a piece of cake using only 2 cells each?

Here's the challenge: Return ALL results from **AND, EQUAL, OR and XOR** operations respectively, **using only two memory cells** in total.


## Example

For input = `"AA"` (charcode 65,65), your BF program should return `"\1\1\1\0"` (`\1` being true and `\0` being false):
* AND result = `'\1'` (true if both charcodes are non-zero)
* EQUAL result = `'\1'` (true if the two charcodes are equal)
* OR result = `'\1'` (true if at least one of the charcodes is non-zero)
* XOR result = `'\0'` (true if exactly one of the charcodes is zero/non-zero)


---

Program size is limited to **less than 1000 BF commands `[]+-<>,.`** to prevent hardcoding.

Good Luck & Have Fun!!! ðŸ§
